children.name: rows

parameters.name: val `Array`
parameters.description: The rows configuration. Accepts the same values as the [row](#configuration-rows) option.

children.description: Get or sets the rows configuration.

children.name: measuresAxis
children.description: Get the name of the axis on which measures are displayed.

children.name: measures

parameters.name: val `Array`
parameters.description: The measures configuration. Accepts the same values as the [measures](#configuration-measures-values) option.

children.description: Get or sets the measures configuration.

children.name: expandRow
Example - expand second level tuple member

parameters.name: path `Array`
parameters.description: The path that uniquely specifies the tuple member that needs to be expanded.

children.description: Expands a row tuple member that has children.> The path should includes the unique member names until the significant (the one that needs to be expanded) member is reached.

children.name: expandColumn
Example - expand second level tuple member

parameters.name: path `Array`
parameters.description: The path that uniquely specifies the tuple member that needs to be expanded.

children.description: Expands a column tuple member that has children.> The path should includes the unique member names until the significant (the one that needs to be expanded) member is reached.

children.name: discover

parameters.name: options `String`
parameters.description: The options of the discover request

children.description: Starts discover request with given options.

children.name: cube
children.description: Get or sets the current cube name.

children.name: columns

parameters.name: val `Array`
parameters.description: The columns configuration. Accepts the same values as the [columns](#configuration-columns) option.

children.description: Get or sets the columns configuration.

children.name: catalog
children.description: Get or sets the current catalog name.

children.name: axes
children.description: Get the parsed axes data

children.name: schema.measures
Example - set measures schema information as a function
Example - specify the field which contains measures schema information as a string

children.description: The field from the server response which contains the measures schema information. Can be set to a function which is called toreturn the measures schema information for the response. It is executed during the schema discover.

children.name: schema.levels
Example - set levels schema information as a function
Example - specify the field which contains levels schema information as a string

children.description: The field from the server response which contains the levels schema information. Can be set to a function which is called toreturn the levels schema information for the response. It is executed during the schema discover.

children.name: schema.hierarchies
Example - set hierarchies schema information as a function
Example - specify the field which contains hierarchies schema information as a string

children.description: The field from the server response which contains the hierarchies schema information. Can be set to a function which is called toreturn the hierarchies schema information for the response. It is executed during the schema discover requests.

children.name: schema.dimensions
Example - set dimensions schema information as a function
Example - specify the field which contains dimensions schema information as a string

children.description: The field from the server response which contains the dimensions schema information. Can be set to a function which is called toreturn the dimensions schema information for the response. It is executed during the schema discover.

children.name: schema.data
Example - set cells data as a function
Example - specify the field which contains cells data as a string

children.description: The field from the server response which contains the cells data. Can be set to a function which is called toreturn the cells data for the response.

children.name: schema.cube
Example - define cube measures which calculates the sum of products price
Example - specify a result function calculating the final value
Example - specify an aggregate function for a value summing
Example - specify a built-in "average" aggregate function

children.description: The cube declaration. If configured this option will enable the client cube processing, usefull for binding to flat data. Note: This is only applicable if client cube processing is used.

children.name: schema.cubes
Example - set cubes schema information as a function
Example - specify the field which contains cubes schema information as a string

children.description: The field from the server response which contains the list of cubes available in the catalog. Can be set to a function which is called toreturn the cubes schema information for the response. It is executed during the schema discover.

children.name: schema.catalogs
Example - set cubes schema information as a function
Example - specify the field which contains catalogs schema information as a string

children.description: The field from the server response which contains the list of catalogs available on the server. Can be set to a function which is called toreturn the catalogs schema information for the response. It is executed during the schema discover.

children.name: schema.axes
Example - set columns and rows axes data as a function
Example - specify the field which contains columns and rows axes as a string

children.description: The field from the server response which contains the columns and rows axes data. Can be set to a function which is called toreturn the columns and rows axes data for the response.

children.name: schema
children.description: The schema configuration of the PivotDataSource.

children.name: transport.connection.cube
Example - set the cube catalog name

children.description: The cube name in the current data source.

children.name: transport.connection.catalog
Example - set the connection catalog name

children.description: The catalog name.

children.name: transport.connection
children.description: The configuration used for setting connection options.

children.name: transport.discover
Example - set the discover remote service

children.description: The configuration used when the data source discovers schema information about the current cube.> The data source uses [jQuery.ajax](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax) to make a HTTP request to the remote service. The value configured via `transport.discover` is passed to `jQuery.ajax`. This means that you can setall options supported by `jQuery.ajax` via `transport.read` except the `success` and `error` callback functions which are used by the transport.If the value of `transport.discover` is a function, the data source invokes that function instead of `jQuery.ajax`.If the value of `transport.discover` is a string the data source uses this string as the URL of the remote service.If the value of `transport.discover` is omitted the data source uses `transport.read` for schema discover.

children.name: transport
children.description: The configuration used to load data items and discover schema information.

children.name: rows.name
children.description: The hierarchal name of the rows

children.name: rows.expand
Example - set the rows as expanded

children.description: If set to true the member will be expanded.

children.name: rows
children.description: The configuration of rows axis members. An array of JavaScript objects or strings. A JavaScript objects are interpreted as rows descriptors. Strings are interpreted as the hierarchal name of the member.

children.name: measures.axis
children.description: The name of the axis on which the measures will be displayed. Supported values are rows or columns. This option is applicable if multiple measures are used.

children.name: measures.values
children.description: An string array which values are interpreted as the name of the measures to be loaded.

children.name: measures
children.description: The configuration of measures. An string array which values are interpreted as the name of the measures to be loaded.Measures can be defined as a list of objects with `name` and `type` fields:    [{        name: "[Measures].[_Internet Current Quarter Sales Performance Status]",        type: "status"    }]> The `type` value can be defined to "status" or "trend" to render [kpiStatusTemplate](/api/javascript/ui/pivotgrid#configuration-kpiStatusTemplate)or [kpiTrendTemplate](/api/javascript/ui/pivotgrid#configuration-kpiTrendTemplate). If type is not defined, then the[dataCellTemplate](/api/javascript/ui/pivotgrid#configuration-dataCellTemplate) will be used.

children.name: columns.name
children.description: The hierarchal name of the column

children.name: columns.expand
Example - set the column as expanded

children.description: If set to true the member will be expanded.

children.name: columns
children.description: The configuration of columns axis members. An array of JavaScript objects or strings. A JavaScript objects are interpreted as column descriptors. Strings are interpreted as the hierarchal name of the member.
